alert.note: Alert for Rutland (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 10:38AM EDT until July 13 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Otter Creek At Center Rutland affecting Rutland County. For the Otter Creek...including Center Rutland, Middlebury...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Otter Creek at Center Rutland. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Many homes will continue to be affected until flood waters recede. Flood levels will be similar to those seen in Irene in August 2011. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EDT Tuesday was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 6.0 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EDT.
